question:
We are rewriting copy for a flyer for a nominee seeking the National Party candidacy for the Maungakiekie electorate.

The initial draft from the client below is written in the third person, is too long, and is too much like a biography. We want to rewrite it into the first person, roughly cut the length in half, and use the biographical points as reasons for why the nominee would make a good candidate.

Rewrite the copy below to achieve those aims.

Client draft:
Kushmiita Parmjeet Kaur Parmar was born into an Indian Air Force family. She had a wonderful upbringing with a supportive family who helped her become the woman she is today. Her father, in a ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶. country and a ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ institution insisted on giving his daughters opportunities that many would only give to sons, which is why Parmjeet has always been adamant that merit should outweigh identity. 
 
As a young girl Parmjeet overheard her parents talking about a family friend who was dying. She could not understand why this was happening, and decided to become a doctor. As a teenager she realised that doctors help individuals, while scientists help populations, leading her to embark on an academic career that culminated with a Ph.D. in Biological Sciences with a focus on Neuroscience at the University of Auckland. 
 
Parmjeet‚Äôs parents instilled values through example. They worked hard, saved hard and made sacrifices that allowed them offer to fund Parmjeet‚Äôs studies provided she worked hard and got good results. This is exactly the kind of message we need to deliver to all those who expect something for nothing and if we want to get ahead. 
 
While gaining her Ph.D. Parmjeet & her husband Ravinder started a family, and are proud parents of Jagmeet and Abhijeet. Parmjeet & her husband own & manage Kiwi Empire Confectionery, which makes all manner of lollies & chocolates. Kiwi empire is based in Maungakiekie, and some of you may have cursed us when your kids have demanded treats in the supermarket. 
 
The business has expanded into health products, manufacturing for many local and multinational brands. 
 
Along with her involvement in the family business, Parmjeet have had the opportunity to build her career outside the business as well. This includes involvement in a number of NGOs & Charities, and being appointed to the Families Commission by the John Key lead government. 
Share Prompt
subject: instructional_rewriting
answer:
I am Kushmiita Parmjeet Kaur Parmar, born into an Indian Air Force family and raised with a strong sense of hard work and determination. My parents always believed in giving their daughters the same opportunities as their sons, teaching me that merit should always outweigh identity.

From a young age, I was inspired to become a doctor after overhearing my parents discussing a family friend who was dying. This desire evolved as I grew older, leading me to pursue a Ph.D. in Biological Sciences with a focus on Neuroscience at the University of Auckland.

My parents' values of hard work and sacrifice motivated me to excel in my studies, with their support allowing me to achieve my academic goals. This message of earning success through hard work is one that I am passionate about sharing with others.

In addition to my academic achievements, I am also a proud mother of two and co-owner of Kiwi Empire Confectionery, a business based in Maungakiekie. Through our business, we have expanded into health products and have served the local community with our products.

Outside of my business endeavors, I have been actively involved in various NGOs and charities, as well as being appointed to the Families Commission by the government. My diverse experiences have shaped me into a candidate who is dedicated to serving the Maungakiekie electorate with integrity and passion.

question:

My stance is that the principles of good security should apply irrespective of a company‚Äôs growth phase. ‚ÄòGood security‚Äô is usually commensurate with a company‚Äôs risk posture and tolerance. Some controls are dictated by headquarters locations, industry verticals, or fiduciary responsibilities. But for the most part, the work necessary to define a level of acceptance for certain types of threats and vulnerabilities just doesn‚Äôt take place. Fortunately, modern compliance frameworks are starting to recognize this and include it into their frameworks.

answer: Good security is essential for companies in any growth phase. The level of acceptance towards threats and vulnerabilities should be defined beforehand, but often this work is not prioritized. Some controls depend on the location, industry, or responsibilities of the company, but generally, a certain level of security should be maintained. Modern compliance frameworks seem to agree, as they are beginning to include these measures. Raising the bar for security measures is always beneficial, and it's encouraging to see compliance frameworks reflecting this.

question:
Rewrite this article in an NLP friendly way:

The interview is an important part of the process in landing a software engineer job. Candidates will often have to complete technical tasks and describe in detail the projects they have worked on.

If a recruiter is even going to consider selecting you for an interview, your resume has to impress them. Read below for guidance on how to make that happen.

Choosing the best resume format is important and often industry-specific.

The most common and efficient way for software engineers to present their skills and experience is to use a reverse chronological resume format. With this format, you present your working experience, starting with the most recent one.

Use bold text and action verbs to emphasize your achievements and results. Add custom sections and headers to your resume to improve scannability.

Recruiters use ATS (Applicant Tracking Systems) to filter resumes by relevant keywords. Tailoring your resume to your target job is crucial if you don‚Äôt want to get passed over before your resume even makes it in front of a person.

Depending on the role you‚Äôre applying for, you might want to make your resume stand out by tapping into your creative side.

Now let‚Äôs talk about what sections you should include on your resume.
subject: instructional_rewriting
answer:
The interview is a crucial step in securing a software engineer job, where candidates showcase technical skills and project experience. To land an interview, your resume must impress recruiters with the right format and content.

Choosing the best resume format is key, especially for software engineers. The reverse chronological format, starting with the most recent experience, is commonly used. Highlight achievements with bold text and action verbs, and customize sections for better readability.

Recruiters use ATS to filter resumes based on keywords, so tailoring your resume to the job is essential. To stand out, consider adding a touch of creativity to your resume based on the role you're applying for.

When constructing your resume, include sections that highlight your skills, experience, and achievements.

question:
Take this story and improve it. Keep the story the same but give describe the surroundings, feelings, and thoughts more meaningfully to paint a picture in a person's mind with your words.

The origin story of the Duulo-Vraktor bloodline has been passed down for generations. It all started with Mitne, a dragon deity with glossy rainbow scales. He was the guardian of the forest and kept the natural balance. Mitne had long transcended past pride many years before time or history was a concept. For this reason, he regarded everything in the forest as his equal and took his time building meaningful friendships with all life. 

Elves, often being a very traditional race, lived in harmony with the forest and their friend. Many generations of elves learned much from Mitne and he cherished the elves' sincerity and mistakes in their short lives of around 750 years which to him was like the blink of an eye. All they had ever known was peace as far as they could remember. 

Those who stumbled onto the forest would be in natural awe of Mitne and those who came with bad intentions had their hearts purified at the sight of him and their souls soothed when he spoke to them. For the first time, those people felt the shadows in their heart lifted, seeing the world with fresh eyes. Finally they could hear nature's timeless song: the gentle wind that makes the grass whistle, a drop of dew falling from the leaf of a tree onto a rock and dirt, the dancing leaves and petals as they fell and were swept up again. One sobbing person worked up all his strength to ask Mitne, "I have done much evil for the sake of my own greed and lust. I came to plunder your forest yet your presence lifted all the clouds in me, like I am a newborn again. How have you done this?"

Mitne never looked away from the man. He always listened mindfully. The great dragon closed his eyes not to ponder the question for he knew the answer. He just listened to nature's timeless song for a moment longer with the man. "Thank you.", said the man.

Mitne replied, "I gave you a taste of the essence of true divinity. If there is still some good in one's heart then it cleanses all impurities. True evil is very rare. If no goodness is left in a creature, then darkness will attempt to consume the divinity and fail. Darkness promises power and when it's overwhelmed by the light, which is the very thing it abandoned for power it will cause the mind to go mad from fear and die. In these cases I cleanse the souls and they enter the cycle of rebirth."

The man had just been given insight into the great order and broke down crying.

"You have grasped the true weight of your own guilt. Your tears are a testament to your sincerity as you mourn the futures of others that you took. Punishment is not the answer to atonement. Live by finding your own path to divinity."

"Where do I start?"

"Anywhere. Fill the world with flowers so that others may hear nature's timeless song as you have today."

He had found his resolve and walked onward without looking back out of respect for Mitne. He knew Mitne regarded him as a friend, something he never imagined could happen before that day, so he went out to become someone worthy of the trust of a real friend.

Many tribes had populated the forest over many centuries. One day Mitne went to each tribe to announce he was leaving. The news was really sudden. There was no great conflict or grand reason. He just said it was time to go. He told everyone, when he goes, the egg of his nextborn will be created. The day of departure came and everyone made a circle around his favorite resting spot and smiled so the last thing he would see before returning to the gods would be joy in the faces of all his friends. 

He knew how their hearts truly wept. He was honored, his last words: "I am always with you all, my dear friends." 

Time and space twisted and distorted and flashed and he was gone leaving a rainbow scaled egg behind.

A young prodigious diviner forth saw the hatching of the next forest guardian was to be on the very next day.

By the egg's will, only the youth from all life of the forest had been summoned to come that night to witness the awakening. As the sun set and the moon reached its peak on the starry, black canvas, the young diviner strummed her harp, the youth played their forest flutes, and the forest creatures howled, and roared, and watched as the egg slowly cracked and a beautiful, colossal creature emerged. 

Everyone went silent. The new rainbow dragon looked around at every creature for a while and finally broke the silence with a greeting.

"I am Duulo." 

As a diety, Duulo was born with great knowledge of himself, his name, and his purpose. Mitne's rainbow scales would sparkle poetically from each of the sun ray's kisses, while Duulo appeared to shine his own hue beside the moonlight.

"My father has kept this forest in a state of everlasting peace for as long as it has existed. The creatures of the forest are strong and many beyond this forest have been saved and feel indebted to my father. His gift to his friends was the strength to overcome your own battles. I will guide you to fully realizing that strength but your battles are your own to fight. So youth of this forest, you all will one day set out to see this world and grow in a new way, so hone your path until then. Carry on this message after you make your way back home."

As the sun rose Duulo curled up and went to sleep.

His message came as a surprise to many in the forest. The diviners confirmed that if the forest didn't prepare and heed Duulo's words that for the first time in their history they would not be ready for the battles to come.

Duulo woke up every night and many came to him for advice. Trade opened up to the neighboring villages and kingdoms. The artisans, great sorcerers, bards, storytellers and many more built up great influence. 

The young diviner prodigy watched the moon every night while strumming her harp and Duulo would join her. This continued for hundreds of years. The forest and it's folk had succeeded and grown. Finally it was time for all the youth to set out.

Duulo told that it too was his time to go, that the forest was now in the hands of it's creatures.

The young prodigious diviner was named Ernaya. She was blind from birth but saw the world through various futures because of her gift. Duulo has been quietly in love with her for centuries. He would not be bound by divine duty. Although many dragons are splendid shapeshifters, Duulo did something even Ernaya nor even the heavens could foresee, he reincarnated as a mortal, freeing himself from his duty. He also healed Ernaya's eyes and changed her fate. They went on countless adventures together. Duulo never hid who he was. The forest people came to accept Duulo's choice and love for Ernaya. Their family name became known as the Duulo-Vraktor with a lineage that lives to this day. Elves of Duulo's blood continue the pilgrimage that their ancestors once took, seeking their own answers to freedom. The dragon blood manifests itself at it's prime in those who discover the price that freedom comes at and their children are also blessed with strong dragon blood as well.

Not everyone returns, but in honoring this tradition none regret seeking the answer.
subject: instructional_rewriting
answer:
The forest where Mitne resided was a sanctuary of vibrant life and colors. The trees stood tall and proud, their leaves rustling in the gentle breeze that carried the scents of wildflowers and moss. Sunlight filtered through the canopy, casting dappled shadows on the forest floor. The air was filled with the symphony of nature - birds singing, insects buzzing, and the gentle murmur of a nearby stream.

Mitne himself was a sight to behold, his glossy rainbow scales shimmering in the sunlight like a kaleidoscope. His presence exuded a sense of ancient wisdom and tranquility, his eyes reflecting the depth of his understanding and compassion for all living beings in the forest.

The elves, with their pointed ears and graceful movements, lived in perfect harmony with the forest and Mitne. Their homes were woven into the trees, blending seamlessly with nature. They moved with an air of reverence around Mitne, their actions filled with respect and gratitude for the guardian of their home.

When outsiders stumbled into the forest, they were met with a sense of awe and wonder at the sight of Mitne. His mere presence had a transformative effect on them, washing away their dark intentions and filling them with a newfound sense of peace and clarity. The man who came seeking to plunder the forest found himself cleansed of his greed and lust, his heart lightened by the divinity that Mitne exuded.

As Mitne spoke to the man, the forest seemed to hold its breath, the leaves falling in hushed reverence, the animals pausing in their movements to listen. The man's tears were a testament to the weight of his guilt, his soul laid bare before the dragon deity. Mitne's words carried the power of ages, his voice resonating with the truth of his wisdom.

When Duulo hatched from his egg, the forest was bathed in the soft glow of the moonlight, the creatures of the forest gathered around in silent awe. His arrival marked a new era for the forest, a time of growth and change. Duulo's words carried the weight of his lineage, his purpose clear and unwavering.

As Duulo guided the youth of the forest, his presence continued to inspire greatness and courage in those who sought his counsel. The forest flourished under his watchful gaze, the creatures living in harmony and unity.

The bond between Duulo and Ernaya, the blind diviner prodigy, was a thing of beauty and wonder. Their love transcended boundaries of time and duty, their adventures becoming legend in the forest. The Duulo-Vraktor bloodline became a symbol of freedom and love, their lineage spanning generations and carrying the legacy of their ancestors.

The forest continued to thrive, its people embarking on journeys of self-discovery and growth. The pilgrimage to seek answers and freedom became a sacred tradition, each traveler honoring the legacy of Duulo and the lessons he imparted.

In the end, the forest stood as a testament to the power of friendship, love, and the enduring spirit of the Duulo-Vraktor bloodline. The echoes of Mitne's wisdom and Duulo's guidance lingered in the air, a reminder of the beauty and magic that existed within the heart of the forest.

question:
Rewrite the email above with a different prhasing. Keep the level of formality.

Dear Councilmember [Name],

I would like to add my support as a constituent in [Neighborhood] to a bill that was recently introduced, # Int 0501-2022. This bill would help in the enforcement of blocked bike lanes, crosswalks, and sidewalks, which any pedestrian or biker in NYC knows is a massive problem. Blocked lanes and sidewalks are a contributing factor to our deadly traffic problem, forcing bikers and pedestrians into traffic and creating an inconvenience and hazard to everyone else.

I like this bill because it builds off the success of the idling commercial truck laws, which allow citizens to report violations ‚Äî adding actual consequences to breaking the law and providing an additional revenue stream for the city.

Typically, when we report bike lane blockages via 311, the police response is non-existent and therefore enforcement is non-existent. Many people feel free to use the bike lanes as their personal parking space, and they take advantage of that to the fullest. Allowing citizens to report these blockages directly would show the people of NYC that they can't simply block these lanes and sidewalks without a fine, at a minimum. It would also bring in an underutilized source of revenue for the city at no real additional cost.

In asking for your support of this bill I would also ask that while the bill is in committee the language is updated to remove the 1320-foot school proximity requirement so that it can be enforced citywide.

I hope we can count on your support for this bill!

Thanks, [Name]
subject: instructional_rewriting
answer:
Dear Councilmember [Name],

I am writing to express my support for the recently introduced bill # Int 0501-2022, as a resident of [Neighborhood]. This legislation is crucial for addressing the widespread issue of blocked bike lanes, crosswalks, and sidewalks in NYC, which significantly contribute to the city's traffic fatalities. These obstructions force cyclists and pedestrians into traffic, creating risks and inconveniences for all.

This bill is commendable as it extends the principles of the successful idling commercial truck laws by enabling citizens to report infractions. This not only holds violators accountable but also opens up a potential revenue stream for the city.

Currently, reporting blocked bike lanes through 311 often leads to no police action, effectively rendering enforcement null. This has emboldened many to misuse these lanes for parking, fully exploiting this lack of oversight. Direct reporting by citizens would underscore that such behavior will lead to fines, at the very least, and tap into a neglected revenue source without incurring significant additional costs.

I urge you to support this bill and recommend revising its language during the committee stage to eliminate the 1320-foot school proximity restriction, ensuring citywide enforcement.

I look forward to your support on this matter.

Thank you, [Name]

question:
this is my initial spec:

Title: HPI Service Design Technical Specification

Overview:
This technical specification describes the design of the HPI service, a Java-based component that performs business logic for the USTLO module. The HPI service is responsible for managing a network connections model and communicating with USTLO using bi-directional messages in a custom format.

Functionality:
The HPI service performs the following functions:

Receives messages from USTLO
Updates the network connections model based on the received messages
Triggers business logic conditions as necessary
Sends commands to USTLO via messages in response to triggered business logic conditions
Communication Protocol:
The HPI service communicates with USTLO using a custom bi-directional message format. Messages contain mandatory parameters in a fixed part followed by a list of optional parameters in TLV format. The message type and length are included in the first four bytes of the message, followed by the number of TLVs and the fixed part. The TLV section is divided into the number of TLVs in the header and the list of TLVs after the fixed part.

Model:
The HPI service stores a model of network connections in a module called "model". The model is updated based on the messages received from USTLO and contains the following data:

Session manager: Maps client IP addresses to client sessions
Client session: Stores client profiles and a mapping from ports to client connections named "flow params"
Flow params: Stores connection metadata
Connections (flow params) can be grouped into related connection groups based on criteria such as playback
Flows:
A client session starts when the client goes online and ends when the HPI receives notification of the end of the session or enough time has passed. During the session, connections are created and destroyed, and metadata can be updated from USTLO and other services. When a session or connection ends, details are logged in a transaction log.

Service Level Agreements:
The HPI service should meet the following service level agreements:

Availability: The HPI service should be available for use by all USTLO workers at all times. The service should be scaled as needed and monitored for health and capacity. In the event of a failure, a new instance of the service will be started as soon as possible. However, it should be noted that a failure of an HPI service can cause the loss of live session and connection data, which may result in default behavior from USTLO.
Response Time: The HPI service should respond to all requests within a reasonable timeframe, taking into account the processing time for both the HPI service and USTLO.
Error Handling: The HPI service should handle errors and exceptions gracefully and log them for debugging purposes. The service should not propagate errors to USTLO and should be able to handle situations where it receives messages mid-flow.
Compliance: The HPI service must comply with all relevant regulations and standards, such as GDPR and HIPAA.
I would like to work on this specification and enhance it, my main focus is detailed description of the underlying architecture and model used. 

your job is to ask me a list of questions that will help me make this spec more robust and detailed 

-- here is some additional information 

Components and Interactions:

The HPI service interacts with the following components:

USTLO: a high throughput proxy that acts as an entry point for network connections. The HPI service provides business logic to USTLO for managing network connections and communication with other services.
SPM: a service that provides the HPI service with user profiles, which are used for session management and connection metadata.
CEMS: a central configuration service that is used to configure all services, including the HPI service.
Sharding and User Sessions:

The HPI service runs as a sharded cluster, where each HPI instance deals with a subsection of clients connecting to the network through the USTLO proxy. The USTLO proxy is responsible for sharding the users between the available HPIs and notifying the same HPI about events of the same user. Specifically, events about the same user (based on its source IP) should only arrive at one HPI for the duration of the user session.

Architecture and Design:

The sharding of the HPI service enables scalability and fault tolerance, as each HPI instance can handle a subset of users and can be independently monitored and scaled. The communication between the HPI service and the other components is based on a custom message format and includes authentication, encryption, and access controls to ensure security and compliance with regulations.

The SPM service provides user profiles that include information such as user credentials, preferences, and metadata related to the network connections. This information is used by the HPI service to manage user sessions and connection metadata, which are stored in the network connections model. The CEMS service provides configuration information for the HPI service, including parameters such as the maximum message size, supported data types, and error handling mechanisms.

The sharding and user session management of the HPI service ensure that each HPI instance only receives and processes events related to a subset of users, reducing the processing load and avoiding duplication of events. The HPI service is designed to handle failures and errors gracefully and log them for debugging purposes. Performance metrics and monitoring mechanisms are used to evaluate the performance and health of the HPI service and its interactions with other components.
-- and some more information 

The USTLO high throughput proxy is a single service that uses multiple workers, each bound to a CPU, to handle network connections. The use of multiple workers ensures that the traffic of a connected client is directed to the same worker, providing consistency and reducing the overhead of communication between workers. The workers are designed to be completely independent from each other, allowing for scalability and fault tolerance.

The USTLO service includes a dispatcher that routes client packets to the appropriate worker, based on the client's source IP address. This ensures that traffic from a connected client is directed to the same worker throughout the duration of the session, improving performance and reducing latency. The dispatcher also supports load balancing and failover mechanisms, allowing for dynamic allocation of client traffic to available workers.

The USTLO service is designed to interact with multiple instances of the HPI service, further sharding the client load between the available HPIs. The HPI service provides business logic to USTLO for managing network connections and communication with other services, including session management and connection metadata. The communication between USTLO and the HPI service is based on a custom bi-directional message format and includes mechanisms for authentication, encryption, and access control.

--- and some more info 

The HPI service includes several business logic conditions that can be triggered based on various factors, such as the type of connection, the headers in the request, and the ongoing status of the connection. Some examples of these conditions include:

Adaptive bit rate management: The HPI service analyzes the first packet of a connection, typically the client hello message, to determine the type of connection and classify it to a web service, such as YouTube or Netflix. Based on the user profile, the HPI service notifies USTLO of the network parameters to use for the connection. USTLO then adapts the network conditions for that connection to optimize the user experience.

Header enrichment: For HTTP connections, USTLO notifies the HPI service with the headers from the request. Based on rules and the client profile, the HPI service can modify the headers and request USTLO to block the connection, forward it to another IP, or send the client a redirect response. This feature enables the HPI service to customize the network behavior based on the client's preferences and requirements.

Just-in-time feature: USTLO periodically sends updates to the HPI service about an ongoing connection. Based on this data, the HPI service calculates specific network parameters to ensure that the client has a specific amount of data in its buffers. This feature is particularly useful for streaming applications, as it reduces data consumption while avoiding stalling and buffering, improving the user experience.

'Twas frabjous, and the flooberty-doo's
Did slinky-slink and gribble-gribble in the fizzle;
All snarkle-burgs were grawlix-juiced,
And the quibber-jabbers crinkled and sizzle.

And so it was, on the first of flargles,
In the mizz, vurp did clatter and blaze;
The Grand Noodler spoke, and with a zing,
Formed the starry-funk and the groovelings.

The slurp-bubbles below were called "swishy-swash,"
The whoosh-tangles above "fluffy-floof,"
And the bloop-mounds amidst were named "crackle-smash,"
Thus began the jibber-jabber of the world's proof.

The Grand Noodler made the blazies and moons,
To rule the glow and the darkling-swoons;
He filled the gloop-wobbles and shnuffles with critters, strewn,
And on the mumble-lands made beasts with a spark of zoom.

On the sixth day, the Grand Noodler formed man,
In His own image and with His own flan;
He breathed life into the slurp of the sludge,
And gave man dominion over all, with a mirthful nudge.

Thus ends the tale, of the first of flargles,
Of how the world came to be in many scribbles;
May we cherish the gift of flobbers we've been given,
And live in harmony, as one, under the zibber-zibber heavens.
subject: instructional_rewriting
answer:
'Twas wonderful, and the unknown's
Dark matter slinked and slid in the void;

And the deep spoke with a murmur and sighed.

In the beginning, chaos did roar;
The Lord spoke, and with a flash,
Created the stars and the heavens.

The oceans below were called "waters,"
The skies above "firmament,"
And the lands between were named "earth,"
Thus began the world's true form emerged.

God made the sun and moon,
To rule the day and the night;
He filled the seas and lands with creatures,
And on the sixth day, man came to life.

question:
Convert this story to second person point of view. Here is the story: "Once upon a time, in a big forest, there lived a rhinoceros named Roxy. Roxy loved to climb. She climbed trees, rocks, and hills. One day, Roxy found an icy hill. She had never seen anything like it before. It was shiny and cold, and she wanted to climb it.

Roxy tried to climb the icy hill, but it was very slippery. She tried again and again, but she kept falling down. Roxy was sad. She wanted to climb the icy hill so much. Then, she saw a little bird named Billy. Billy saw that Roxy was sad and asked, "Why are you sad, Roxy?"

Roxy told Billy about the icy hill and how she couldn't climb it. Billy said, "I have an idea! Let's find some big leaves to put under your feet. They will help you climb the icy hill." Roxy and Billy looked for big leaves and found some. Roxy put the leaves under her feet and tried to climb the icy hill again.

This time, Roxy didn't slip. She climbed and climbed until she reached the top of the icy hill. Roxy was so happy! She and Billy played on the icy hill all day. From that day on, Roxy and Billy were the best of friends, and they climbed and played together all the time. And Roxy learned that with a little help from a friend, she could climb anything.
"
subject: instructional_rewriting
answer:
Once upon a time, in a vast forest, you are a rhinoceros named Roxy. You love to climb. You climb trees, rocks, and hills. One day, you discover an icy hill. You've never seen anything like it before. It's shiny and cold, and you want to climb it.

You try to climb the icy hill, but it's very slippery. You try again and again, but you keep falling down. You feel sad. You want to climb the icy hill so much. Then, you see a little bird named Billy. Billy notices your sadness and asks, "Why are you sad, Roxy?"

You tell Billy about the icy hill and how you can't climb it. Billy says, "I have an idea! Let's find some big leaves to put under your feet. They will help you climb the icy hill." You and Billy search for big leaves and find some. You put the leaves under your feet and try to climb the icy hill again.

This time, you don't slip. You climb and climb until you reach the top of the icy hill. You are so happy! You and Billy play on the icy hill all day. From that day on, you and Billy are the best of friends, and you climb and play together all the time. And you learn that with a little help from a friend, you can climb anything.

question:
Two professional organizations in my field MLA and CCCC have created a taskforce on AI. Here is a description of what they are doing: 

The Modern Language Association and Conference on College Composition and Communication have formed a joint task force (co-chairs Holly Hassel and Elizabeth Matthews Losh) to develop resources, guidelines, and professional standards around the use of AI and writing.

Committee Charge
This joint task force will work to address a number of member needs related to Writing and AI (Large Language Models, ChatGPT, LaMBA, etc.) such as the following: 

Taking stock of the current state of the issue and identifying implications for teachers, students, organizations, and scholars
Creating community for members to share resources
Creating resources that will synthesize, set professional standards, and make recommendations/provide guidance to members
Supporting and mapping out promising directions of scholarly interest for learning more about the issue

I know one of the task force members Anna and I want to request her to consider adding me to the task force and here is an email I've drafted for that purpose. Please revise the email to make it more persuasive and smooth: 

Dear Anna,

I hope that you are well. 

Following up from our twitter conversation, I wanted to request you to consider allowing me to serve on the MLA-CCCC Taskforce on AI in writing. 

I am a third year PhD scholar in Rhetoric and Composition at the University of Arizona. Originally from India, my research and teaching goals include making computational technologies more accessible and emotionally less stressful for Humanities and Social Science students. In pursuit of that goal, I've conducted usability tests on a range of tools and designed textbooks and workshops that've helped teach text-mining, corpus linguistics, and data visualisation to a diversity of student populations across India and the US. Apart from my strong background in humanities, and social science, I also have technical expertise in Python based data science, which enables me to research and teach with technologies with greater rigor. For the potential in my research, I was recently awarded the Scholars for the Dream Award by the CCCC. 

I've also taught academic writing and worked as a Writing Program Administrator in India an the US for over five years. In both contexts, I have experience with drafting academic policies. In India, for example, I helped my program develop policies and resources on how to transition to online teaching during the Covid pandemic. 

Given my experience, skillsets, and positionality, I feel that I will be able to bring an important perspective to the task force as it helps our field navigate the ongoing AI challenge. 

I've attached my CV with this mail for your consideration and you can also see my work portfolio by clicking here. 

I'd be grateful if you might share my request with the rest of the committee members and consider adding me to it. I will be honoured to serve. 

Thanks so much for your time and consideration. 
Warmly,
Anuj
subject: instructional_rewriting
answer:
Dear Anna,

I hope this message finds you well.

Following our recent conversation on Twitter, I am reaching out to express my interest in joining the MLA-CCCC Taskforce on AI in writing. I believe that my background and experiences uniquely position me to contribute meaningfully to the important work being done by the task force.

As a third-year PhD scholar in Rhetoric and Composition at the University of Arizona, with a focus on making computational technologies more accessible and less stressful for Humanities and Social Science students, I have conducted usability tests on various tools and designed educational materials that have successfully taught complex concepts to diverse student populations in both India and the US. My technical expertise in Python-based data science further enhances my ability to engage with technological advancements with rigor and depth.

Having taught academic writing and served as a Writing Program Administrator for over five years, I have a strong foundation in developing academic policies and resources. For example, I played a key role in guiding my program through the transition to online teaching during the Covid-19 pandemic in India. question:
Please re-write this in a professional, concise yet informative way:

Informed Consent for Therapy Services and Practice Policies:
I, Fabio Fina, MSW, LCSW, am a licensed clinical social worker in the state of Colorado (License # CSW.09926963). I received my Master's degree in Social Work from the Metropolitan State University of Denver I hold certifications in trauma therapy (Brainspotting Levels 1 and 2) and am currently studying in a 3-year post-graduate training and receiving supervision in Intensive Short-Term Dynamic Psychotherapy (ISTDP) from Jon Frederickson, MSW.

By signing this document, you acknowledge that you have read and understand the following:

‚Ä¢ The therapeutic relationship is a unique and personal contract between us. It has the potential to improve emotional functioning, relationships, self-image, self-esteem, mood, and personal goals. However, some discomfort may be a part of the process and in rare cases, clients have reported feeling worse after therapy.
‚Ä¢ Our sessions will be confidential, however, there are some legal and ethical exceptions to confidentiality that I am required to disclose. These include situations involving child abuse, elder abuse, threats of harm to yourself or others, and court-ordered disclosures.
‚Ä¢ You understand the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) and the ways in which your protected health information (PHI) may be used for treatment, payment, and healthcare operations.
‚Ä¢ You understand that therapy is not a substitute for medical care and that I will recommend seeking medical attention if needed.
‚Ä¢ You have the right to terminate therapy at any time and to request a copy of your records.
---
Welcome to your psychotherapy sessions.

You have taken a positive step by seeking therapy. Participating in individual therapy can benefit you in many ways, such as improving your understanding of personal goals and values, enhancing personal relationships, and resolving specific problems you face. However, it is important to understand that therapy is not a magic solution, and change does not occur overnight.

The outcome of your treatment will depend largely on your willingness to engage in the process, which may sometimes result in discomfort. Remembering unpleasant events and becoming aware of feelings attached to those events can bring on intense feelings of anger, depression, anxiety, etc. There are no miracle cures, and I cannot promise that your behavior or circumstances will change. The extent to which you are open and honest about yourself will play a role in how quickly you can achieve your goals.

To prepare for your session, I recommend finding a quiet and private room without interruptions or distractions. Bring paper and a pen, or something to write with. Think of an issue that you would like to bring to our session. I also recommend keeping a journal to write thoughts, questions, reflections, insights, and progress gained through therapy.

Therapy has both benefits and risks. Risks may include experiencing uncomfortable feelings, such as sadness, guilt, anxiety, anger, frustration, loneliness, and helplessness. However, therapy has been shown to benefit individuals who undertake it. Although the majority of people do get better in therapy, some do get worse. Your therapist makes no guarantee of results.

Client rights and important information:
I am a licensed clinical social worker in the state of Colorado, regulated by the Board of Social Work Examiners, which can be reached at 1560 Broadway, Suite 1350, Denver, Colorado 80202, (303) 894-7766.

As a licensed professional, I hold a master's degree in social work and have completed two years of post-master supervision.

As a client, you have the right to:

‚Ä¢ Seek a second opinion from another therapist
‚Ä¢ Terminate therapy at any time, with the recommendation of a closure session when possible
‚Ä¢ Receive information about my methods of therapy, techniques used, estimated duration of therapy, and fee structure
It is important to note that sexual intimacy between a therapist and client is never appropriate and should be reported to the regulatory board.

Expectations of Therapy:
When you embark on the therapy journey, it's important to understand that change takes time and effort. You have made a positive decision in seeking therapy, but it's important to recognize that it is not a magic cure. As your therapist, I'll be here to support you, but the extent to which you're willing to engage in the process and be open and honest about yourself will play a significant role in how quickly you can achieve your goals.

During our therapy sessions, you can expect a combination of psychoeducation and emotional processing. We'll work together to understand the underlying issues that are causing you distress, and the feelings that are attached to those issues. It's normal to experience a range of intense emotions during therapy, such as anger, depression, and anxiety. These are all understandable reactions, and I encourage you to discuss them with me during our sessions. If you find that individual psychotherapy is not the best fit for you, we can explore other options together.
The first 2-4 sessions will involve an evaluation of your needs and a discussion of treatment goals. If you have any doubts or questions about working with your therapist, they will be happy to assist you in finding another professional for a second opinion.
It is important to remember that therapy results may vary and cannot be guaranteed. It also requires active effort on your part and working on things discussed in therapy outside of sessions.

---
Session length and attendance:
Therapy sessions are typically 50 minutes long and held once a week. To achieve the best results, I recommend committing to 3-6 months of treatment. Please arrive on time and notify me if you are unable to make a session. If you miss a session without giving notice, you will be charged for the session. I have a 48-hour cancellation policy, and in case of emergency or my unavailability, I will reschedule the missed session at no additional cost.

NOTE: I consider our first sessions a "trial-therapy", meaning that we are learning to get to know each other and our styles. If either of us realizes that our therapeutic connection is not a match, we will discuss ways to move forward, including me referring you to a more appropriate mental health provider.

Missed Appointments and Cancellations:
To ensure we can maintain the consistency and progress necessary for therapy, it is important to attend all scheduled sessions and to provide adequate notice for cancellations or changes. If you must miss a session, please contact me at least 48 hours (2 business days) in advance. If less notice is given or if you don't show up without notification, you will be charged for the missed session. In certain cases of emergency or illness, an exception may be made. However, if you miss two or more appointments without notification, treatment may be discontinued. If you have recurring appointments, missing one without notice will result in being charged for that session and rescheduling for the next appointment, but missing a second one without notice will result in cancellation of the recurring appointments unless we make new arrangements.

Fees and Payments:
My standard fee for therapy sessions is $185 per 50-minute session. Additional fees may apply for couples or group therapy. Payment is expected 48 hours prior to the scheduled session. Payment can be made using a credit or debit card, check, cash or electronic transfer. A $10 service charge will apply for returned checks. You have the option to keep a credit card on file and authorize automatic charging for no-show or late cancellation appointments. My fees are reviewed annually, and I will notify you of any changes at least 30 days before they come into effect. Reduced fee services may be available on a sliding scale, please let me know if this is something that would be beneficial to you.

Other Fees:
Additional professional services outside of therapy are charged on a prorated basis.
This may include but is not limited to, consultations, report writing, telephone conversations, meetings, or other services requested.

Insurance:
My fee for a 50-minute therapy session is $185. I do not accept insurance directly, but I can provide you with a superbill that you can submit to your insurance for reimbursement. It's important to check with your insurance provider to see what your out-of-network benefits are. In case of missed or cancelled appointments, I require a 48-hour notice, and you will be charged for the missed session without proper notice. Payment can be made by debit or credit card, check, cash or electronic transfer, and I have an option for you to keep a credit card on file for automatic charging. If you are unable to pay, we can discuss reduced fee options on a sliding scale. Please be aware that as a standard policy, any additional charges incurred, like consultations or report writing, will be billed at my hourly rate. If payment is in arrears for more than 90 days and a fee payment schedule cannot be agreed upon, your account may be turned over to a collection agency or attorney.
subject: instructional_rewriting
answer:
Fabio Fina, MSW, LCSW, is a licensed clinical social worker in Colorado with extensive training in trauma therapy and intensive short-term dynamic psychotherapy. By signing this document, clients acknowledge the therapeutic relationship's potential benefits and risks, confidentiality exceptions, HIPAA regulations, and the importance of seeking medical care when necessary. Clients also have the right to terminate therapy, request records, and receive information about their therapist's qualifications and methods.

Therapy sessions involve emotional processing and psychoeducation to address underlying issues causing distress. Results may vary, and active client participation is crucial for success. Sessions are typically 50 minutes weekly, with 3-6 months of treatment recommended for optimal results. Missed appointments without notice may result in charges, with exceptions made for emergencies.

Fees for therapy sessions are $185 per 50-minute session, with payments due 48 hours in advance. Additional fees may apply for couples or group therapy, and reduced fees may be available on a sliding scale. Clients can submit a superbill to their insurance for reimbursement. Additional professional services are charged at an hourly rate, and payment plans can be arranged for outstanding balances.

Overall, Fabio Fina emphasizes the importance of commitment, consistency, and active engagement in the therapy process to achieve meaningful results.

question:
In the style of Telesign documentation, convert these bullet points lists into customer facing, easy-to-read paragraphs that summarize why we've built the 2-way SMS inbound product feature and how it can be used by customers:

Why was 2 ‚Äì Way SMS created? 
Customers and prospects were interested in simply being able to reply to the SMS to confirm an action, rather than going to a URL or having to enter a code elsewhere. 
This additional layer of security can thwart man-in-the-middle (MITM) attacks and prevent the use of stolen account credentials gained through phishing and other means.

Use Cases
HELP/STOP responses from customers for ARN/MKT traffic
STOP response from end user must post to the callback URL provided by customer for an actual opt-out of future alerts
Concurrently, STOP response from end user must trigger automated opt-out SMS response (managed by TeleSign or customer - CSM to determine this)
HELP response from end user must trigger automated HELP message (managed by TeleSign or customer - CSM to determine this)
note: STOP and HELP responses 
2-way communications between end user and business (our customer)
Transaction Verification (i.e. funds transfer)
Account change confirmation
Login authentication
SSL VPN integration
subject: instructional_rewriting
answer:
We created the 2-Way SMS feature in response to customer feedback, as they wanted a simpler way to confirm actions by replying to SMS messages instead of visiting a URL or entering a code elsewhere. This additional layer of security can help prevent man-in-the-middle attacks and the use of stolen account credentials obtained through phishing. 

The 2-Way SMS feature can be used for various purposes, such as receiving HELP or STOP responses from customers for ARN/MKT traffic. STOP responses from end users can be used to trigger an opt-out process for future alerts. Additionally, HELP responses can trigger automated HELP messages. This feature also enables two-way communication between end users and businesses, allowing for transaction verification, account change confirmation, login authentication, and integration with SSL VPN systems.

question:
Rewrite the given paragraph in a way that adds more detail, elaboration, and information to the original content, ultimately resulting in a longer and more comprehensive version of the same text. Also divide your revised version into two or more paragraphs if you need to.
: "Advantages to renting a home include flexibility, no maintenance costs, fixed housing costs, and access to disposable income for investing that is not available with home ownership. Renting allows the flexibility of moving when your lease ends, or whenever you want if you rent month to month. You could move to another part of town, or to a new city without worrying about selling a home. You are not tied down with a long-term commitment. If you are renting, the landlord is responsible for repairs and maintenance. If something breaks, make a phone call, or send an email and the issue will be corrected. When you rent a home, you have fixed housing costs. Your rent doesn‚Äôt fluctuate, you don‚Äôt have to budget for repairs or property taxes, and you may not pay utilities. Renting can be more affordable in the short term, as renters don‚Äôt have to worry about the initial costs of purchasing a home or paying property taxes. Also, renting may free up disposable income that can be invested to build your financial portfolio (Redfin)."
subject: instructional_rewriting
answer:
Here is a revised and expanded version of the given paragraph:

Renting a home can offer several distinct advantages compared to homeownership. One of the primary benefits is the flexibility it provides. When you rent, you are not tied down to a single location or property. Your lease typically expires after a fixed period, such as 12 months, allowing you to move to a new area or city without the hassle of selling a home. This mobility can be especially advantageous for individuals who need to relocate for work or simply desire a change of scenery. Additionally, renting eliminates the maintenance responsibilities that come with owning a home. As a tenant, you can simply contact the landlord whenever a repair is needed, and they are responsible for addressing the issue. This frees up your time and resources, as you do not have to worry about budgeting for or coordinating home repairs and upkeep.

Another significant advantage of renting is the predictability of housing costs. Rent payments are generally fixed, whereas homeownership can involve fluctuating expenses such as property taxes, insurance premiums, and unexpected repair bills. This financial stability can make it easier to create and adhere to a monthly budget. Furthermore, renting may be more affordable, especially in the short term, as it eliminates the substantial upfront costs associated with purchasing a home, such as a down payment, closing costs, and moving expenses. The money saved by renting can then be directed towards building a financial portfolio through investments, rather than being tied up in home equity.

question:
Rewrite this text as clearly as possible: Arm & Hammer baking soda is a great, natural solution for reducing both moisture and odor in your trash bag. Here's how you can use it:

1. **In the Bin**: Before you put a new trash bag in, sprinkle a generous layer of baking soda at the bottom of the trash bin. This will help absorb any liquid and smells that might escape from the bag.

2. **In the Trash Bag**: For added protection, you can also sprinkle a small amount of baking soda into the bag itself after every few items of trash. 

3. **On Top**: If you notice your trash bag starting to smell, you can sprinkle baking soda on top of the contents. It will help absorb the odor.

4. **Cleaning**: In addition to using baking soda in the bag, you can also use it to clean the trash bin itself. Make a paste with baking soda and water, scrub the interior of the bin, and then rinse it out.

Just remember that while baking soda is excellent for absorbing odors and moisture, it won't replace the need for regular trash disposal and bin cleaning. It's an aid to help control odors and moisture, not a total solution in itself.
subject: instructional_rewriting
answer:
1. Sprinkle a generous layer of Arm & Hammer baking soda at the bottom of your trash bin before inserting a new bag. This will help absorb any liquid and odors that may leak from the bag.
2. For extra protection, sprinkle a small amount of baking soda into the trash bag after every few items of trash.
3. If you detect a smell from your trash bag, sprinkle baking soda on top of the trash to absorb the odor.
4. To clean the trash bin, create a paste with baking soda and water, scrub the inside of the bin, and then rinse it out.

Note: Baking soda is effective in absorbing odors and moisture, but it does not eliminate the need for regular trash disposal and bin cleaning. It serves as an additional tool to manage odors and moisture.

question:
I am writing a Reddit post. Can you make this more readable and engaging:

I just scrolled through the posts from overnight. I want to point out something that it seems many people are forgetting. ChatGPT remembers what a user said earlier in the conversation. Keeping that in mind when someone posts a screenshot of something shocking that ChatGPT said without showing the full thread it's safe to assume that they used previous prompts to set up the response. In other words, when you see a ChatGPT statement that is shocking, inappropriate, or something else it likely was already told how to respond. People should screenshot the full thread or use something like ShareGPT a chrome extension that will create a page that shows the entire thread.
subject: instructional_rewriting
answer:
Just finished scrolling through the overnight posts and noticed something important that seems to be overlooked by many. ChatGPT has the ability to remember past conversations within the same chat. So, when someone shares a screenshot of a shocking or inappropriate response from ChatGPT without showing the full context, it's likely that they guided the AI with previous prompts to provoke that specific reaction. 

To get the whole picture and avoid misunderstandings, it's crucial to either include the full conversation thread in the screenshot or utilize tools like ShareGPT, a chrome extension that generates a page displaying the entire chat history. Let's strive for clarity and accuracy in our discussions with AI!

Hi there.
My name is Kwangtae Kim. 

I am currently a doctoral student in the Industrial and Organizational Psychology program at Yonsei University in South Korea. 

I am currently in pre-registration for the 
"A Multidimensional Quiet Quitting Scale: Development and Test of a Measure of Quiet Quitting" which is in pre-registration, 
I am writing to ask if I can use the Multidimensional Quiet Quitting Scale in my research. 
 
My research interests include Meaningfulness and Calling, and I have had an ongoing interest in Quiet Quitting for the past year or so. 

As there is no officially developed scale for Quiet Quitting yet, I was not able to conduct a survey-based study, and I was conducting a study based on reputation text data of Korean companies on the Internet. 

Then, through Google Scholar Alert, I found a study that my professor had pre-registered for, and I was very grateful. 

The idea that Quiet Quitting consists of two dimensions, emotional and behavioral, really resonated with me, and I couldn't wait to use the scale you developed to conduct my own research. 

Korea is experiencing various social changes due to its rapid economic growth, and Quiet Quitting is spreading in Korean society, especially among millennials and Generation Z, so the need for research is growing. 

Quiet quitting is also being expressed in various ways in various communities of Korean workers, and HR managers are interested in how it can be linked to organizational performance. 

I would like to ask my professor for permission to conduct a study to validate the MQQS scale in Korea. 

I believe that conducting a validation study of the MQQS with a Korean sample would not only make a theoretical contribution by providing empirical evidence of the validity of the MQQS, but would also be very helpful for the development of Quiet Quitting research in Korea.

Kwangtae Kim Dream.

question:
How can I improve how I showcase Koa in the following essay? 

[Koa Runnels, where do we even start with this one. 22 and confused? Misdirected or Unmotivated? What direction is he willing to stick with to make his life satisfying? Koa‚Äôs life is a complicated one to say nonetheless. Even though he has a short life compared to many, he went through quite a journey so far. He still figuring things out as he gets older and still trying to find out who he is. He came to a conclusion recently and finally realized he never made a decision truly for himself. He did what others felt was best for him, and he always went along because he didn‚Äôt want to make waves. Not anymore, he‚Äôs determined to be his own person. Let‚Äôs take a look at a few experiences and piece them together to try to understand his fast-paced and confusing life.]
Born on March 30, 1999, in Fayetteville, North Carolina. Koa entered the world. For the first six years and one week of his life, he lived in North Carolina. Then suddenly, a week after he just turned six. He, his three older sisters, and his mother are heading for Oahu. And for the next sixteen years, he lived up and down the west coast of Oahu. You could say it was exactly the same with his life. ‚ÄúBut to be honest whose isn‚Äôt?‚Äù Koa says as he starts to think back on how he lived his life. How the choices 
It all starts on April 6, 2005, the day that marked where everything changed for the young man. His mother announced to him and his three sisters. He was all for it. They took a trip the year prior to visit his aunt and his grandma. It was his first-ever trip, and no less it was Christmas time when they went. So looking forward to going back so quickly on another ‚Äúvacation‚Äù there was exciting.
At such a young age he didn‚Äôt understand what was really going on. He wondered why his dad was the one dropping us off and why he was so sad. He saw that his sisters were sad as well, so he felt sad too not knowing why. It wasn‚Äôt until a week in he realized that his father wouldn‚Äôt be joining them. ‚ÄúI and your father are getting divorced,‚Äù His mother told him. Little did he know at such a young age what those words meant. It wouldn‚Äôt be long to feel the strain of being different from those who had both parents. Persistently being asked, ‚Äúwhere is your dad? why don‚Äôt you have a dad?‚Äù and all the while Koa didn‚Äôt know how to answer them in the slightest. To get away from this, he remembers always going to the health room. Almost every week he‚Äôd go at least twice, His health room card almost being as thick as a small book by the end of the year. He wasn‚Äôt sick at all, he didn‚Äôt want to be bothered by anyone. Truth was, this young man was experiencing depression. And with such adverse effects at a young age, it was hard for him to open up. 
That wasn‚Äôt the only trial he faced. Coming from a more southern area along with having an accent, and being one of the fairest kids at school, he felt even isolated. One of the worst experiences was between him and a classmate. ‚ÄúHey, that‚Äôs a nice flag drawing you got in your binder, what country is that?‚Äù Koa ask. ‚ÄúYeah, I drew it, and it‚Äôs from the Philippines.‚Äù His classmate replies. Coming from a mixed ethnic family, Koa thought this be a good chance to make another friend with similar interests. ‚ÄúReally? I‚Äôm Filipino too! I got Illicano and Visayan.‚Äù Koa exclaims. ‚ÄúWell you‚Äôll never be a real Filipino and never will have my flag or draw as good as me.‚Äù his classmate scoffs. ‚ÄúUuuuhhhh ok, never asked for your flag and I‚Äôll still be Filipino.‚Äù Koa kinda just stares blankly and walks into his classroom trying to figure out why exactly they said that. He encountered many racially charged experiences but none bothered him as much as that one. Not till years later will he just conclude, ‚ÄúSome people are just too proud and won‚Äôt accept others, that‚Äôs ok I‚Äôll be proud regardless of what others think,‚Äù he smirks as he thinks to himself. 
Koa did in fact have a knack for drawing. Certainly not the best with characters or such. He did excel with cars and buildings, Koa was known for drawing Most of the time during elementary and middle school you‚Äôd find him in class or the library sketching away on grid paper. Why grid paper? Sometime in fifth grade, he was handed a scholastic magazine with blueprints on them. He always drew and was now introduced to architecture. What better than to mesh one hobby with an entirely new one?! So for the coming years, he spent drawing cities upon cities. Creating countless random modern homes on them. He taped them together to make one long picture. This project took up most of his time, and that didn‚Äôt bother him much. One thing about Koa during these times, he didn‚Äôt have many friends and wasn‚Äôt as social as he is now. He struggled, for the most part, to be who he truly was as he haven‚Äôt gotten to explore many pathways life had to offer.
That changed when he got his driver‚Äôs license. Yet another significant change in his life. A new door had been open for the young man, finally able to go out and explore as he always wanted. For most of his life, he would just stay home. A pretty mundane way of life. Go to school, go back home, do chores and that's it. No longer did he have to be anchored or restricted to be stuck at home. Even more so after high school, he got his very first car. The first opportunity to be ankle to socialize freely without having to rely on his mother to take him. Taking full advantage of his opportunity, he goes out with many childhood friends who were as easily accessible to associate with. He starts to be more active and in turn more social when he goes out. Constantly going to the park, playing soccer, able to stay out later. he gains the sense off freedom he never felt before. The young man keeps seeking more and finds a job that is enough to allow him to have time and money. But as time goes on, ‚ÄúHow realistic is this way of life?‚Äù he poses this question to himself.]
subject: instructional_rewriting
answer:
Here are some suggestions for improving how you showcase Koa in this essay:

1. Provide more vivid descriptions and details about Koa's personality, interests, and values to help the reader get a stronger sense of who he is as an individual. The essay currently focuses more on the events of his life rather than painting a clear picture of his character.

2. Use more quotes, anecdotes, or specific examples that reveal Koa's voice, thoughts, and way of viewing the world. This will make him feel like a more realized, multi-dimensional character.

3. Consider restructuring the chronological narrative to highlight pivotal moments or turning points that shaped Koa's sense of identity and path in a more focused way.

4. Develop the thematic threads you introduce (like his struggle to be his own person, feeling unmotivated/misdirected, depression at a young age) through tighter connections between the life events you describe and Koa's inner journey.

5. Clarify Koa's current situation and mindset as a 22-year-old trying to find purpose and satisfaction. Is he actively pursuing new directions? Reflecting on his past? The present-day framing could be stronger.

6. Use more vivid sensory details and descriptive language to immerse the reader in the key settings and time periods of Koa's life.

The goal would be to make Koa feel like a fully fleshed-out, compelling character that readers can vividly picture and empathize with on a deeper level throughout his experiences.

question:
Please fix up my blog article so it's concise, clear and fun. Please use my voice when writing this

"Support Center; my first major project at Vercel, it's been a blast working on it and it's now out. üéâ‚ú®

Check it out vercel.com/changelog/support-center

BTW, I joined Vercel üéâ ~6 months ago...

Well anyway...

Support Center is a modern tool for viewing and communicating with Customer Support at Vercel. Built for enterprises to improve the customer support experience while retaining the practices and tools that the Customer Support Team at Vercel had built up over the years. From what customers and the Customer Support Team have told us we've achieved that goal.

For some background. Before Support Center, customers had to email support before they could get any help üò¨, it was clunky and prone to \*"\*email got sent to spam errors", and \*"\*I didn't check my email problems", realizing that the experience wouldn't do, the dev team drafted up the idea to connect the current Salesforce based ticketing system with a UI/UX customers would enjoy.

The main hiccup we ran into during development was the excessively complex (and archaic) work of integrating with Salesforce and the performance of the support center, of which the solution is caching (the bane of all Software Engineers everywhere).

üìö Fun fact: Salesforces uses a SQL-like syntax for querying data that's similar to SQL but yet very far away from SQL, it's called SOQL, and working with it can be very frustrating

The problems boiled down to: 

How do you keep the cache always up to date? 

How to keep the support center fast, responsive, and reliable with the most up-to-date info? 

How to make working with Salesforce easier?

The solution to the first 2 problems... ü•Å are webhooks of course. 

In essence, whenever a change is made on Salesforce we call a webhook and have that webhook sync with a cache that we use for the support cases ü§Ø.

We can then expand how long the cache should securely hold case data, and add a cache warm-up for when on the main page. 

The last issue was dealing with the complexity of working with Salesforce, we just powered through and though frustrating, I think the results are pretty fantastic.

Working on this project was awesome, and I'm grateful for being able to work with such a capable team of designers & developers on this project.

‚úåÔ∏è "
subject: instructional_rewriting
answer:
"Vercel's Support Center, my inaugural project, is now live! üéâ‚ú® Check it out at vercel.com/changelog/support-center.

Joining Vercel around six months ago, I've been thrilled to work on this modern tool, designed to enhance customer support experience for enterprises while preserving our team's established practices.

Previously, customers relied on email for support, a process prone to errors and delays. Recognizing the need for improvement, our team conceived a UI/UX connecting our Salesforce ticketing system, addressing these issues.

During development, we encountered a major hurdle: integrating with Salesforce's complex system. The solution? Caching, a love-hate relationship for all software engineers. We also faced challenges in keeping the cache updated, maintaining speed and reliability, and simplifying Salesforce interaction.

Webhooks were our saviors! They sync changes from Salesforce with our cache, ensuring up-to-date support case data. We also implemented cache warm-ups and adjusted data retention periods.

Tackling Salesforce's complexity was tough, but the results are worth it. I'm thankful for my talented team of designers and developers who made this journey enjoyable.

Cheers to many more exciting projects at Vercel! ‚úåÔ∏è"

question:
You are Anthropology Professor who assigned the essay to me. This is prompt

In Cannibal Capitalism, Nancy Fraser argues that we need an expanded understanding of capitalism beyond simply a focus on production in order to understand the range of crises affecting the world. In this paper, explain how Fraser extends Marx‚Äôs insights about capitalism to show how capitalism is producing crises but also how these crises afford us avenues for progressive social and political change.

Could you improve my essay below to get A 

-----
The idea that the market is a panacea for our life‚Äôs problems is a central tenet of neoclassical economic thought. Neoclassical economics is a school of economic thought that emphasizes the value of free market competition and how individuals make decisions based on rational calculations of costs and benefits. It assumes that markets are self-regulating and efficient in allocating resources, and that individuals are rational agents who make decisions based on their own self-interest. The invisible hand of the market determines the price based on the supply and demand and maximizes social welfare. This argument has been used to justify the free market policies such as privatization of public services, industry deregulation and the reduction of government intervention in the economy. However, this belief is increasingly being challenged by scholars. While the market can be an effective mechanism for allocating certain resources and creating wealth, it is not a panacea for the social, racial, economic, and environmental challenges that we face today.
Karl Marx, a renowned German philosopher, developed a unique perspective on capitalism, socialism, and communism. His understanding of capitalism differs significantly from neoclassical economists, which asserts that economic activity cannot be understood as a mere process of exchange, but is shaped by the social relations of production (Fraser, 2022, p20). He criticizes the idea of neoclassical economics for failing to address the underlying relations of exploitation and class conflict that are hardwired into capitalism, and for focusing solely on the exchange of goods and services in the market. In contrast, he views capitalism as a system of class domination centered on the exploitation of free labor by capital in commodity production (Fraser, 2022, p44). He analyzes the structure through which a small group of capitalists who own the means of production extract surplus value from the majority of people who have to sell their labor. This results in a system of inequality and exploitation, with capitalists profiting from the labor of workers.
Nancy Frazer, an American philosopher and feminist shares the view with Marx that capitalism is a system that organizes the relation of production and exchange to their non-economic conditions of possibility (Fraser, 2022, p85). Besides, she appreciates the lens of exploitation he introduces as it highlights the structural basis in capitalist society for the class domination of free workers (Fraser, 2022, p45). However, she criticizes and extends Marx‚Äôs view in her book Cannibal Capitalism as she believes that his view does not account for the realm of non-economic activity that is bound up with exploitation sufficiently. She contends that non-marketized aspects such as social reproduction, polity, and natural resources are indispensable to marketized aspects of capitalist societies and ignoring or treating them as if they are infinite and free leads to the cannibalization of our society (Fraser, 2022, p37). In capitalist society, there is a boundary between "production" from "reproduction," "economy" from "polity," and "society" from "nature" to distinguish between them. These resources necessary for economic activity are often viewed as having no monetary value and are taken for granted as if they are free and infinitely available. As they assume no responsibility for sustaining them, this leads to a crisis in social reproduction, race, and ecology. She claims that these crises worsen each other and pose a significant threat to our survival (Fraser, 2022, p16).
 Social reproduction involves not only the activity of reproducing new human beings , but also the maintenance of social bonds that underpins social cooperation (Fraser, 2022, p24). This includes tasks such as giving birth, performing household chores, and socializing the young. However, in capitalist societies, social reproduction is often detached from economic production, leading to care work and affective labor being undervalued unless they are commodified and turned into paid labor (Fraser, 2022, p25). Thus, she criticizes the Marxist view for not fully explaining that behind the process of production is unwaged care work, often performed by women, which replenishes the labor force.This presents a paradox, as the capitalist economy relies on social bonds, but does not accord them monetary value. This ultimately impairs the system‚Äôs ability to produce and maintain labor power (Fraser, 2022, p64, p85). 

Another precondition for the functioning of capitalism is public powers, usually states, that supply legal and military might that enforce and establish constitutive norms (Fraser, 2022, p27). Public power encompasses various functions, such as enacting legal orders, maintaining repressive forces, and providing public goods that serve to guarantee property rights, enforce contracts, settle disputes, and sustain the money supply that is essential to the survival of capital (Fraser, 2022, p116). Legal systems establish what appears to be politically neutral spaces where private actors could pursue their ‚Äúeconomic‚Äù interest without a form of ‚Äúpolitical‚Äù interference. Similarly, at the geopolitical level, transnational political arrangements such as international law and brokered agreements among the Great Powers enable people to expand their business across borders.Accumulation and market exchange are impossible without such a legal and military framework. 

Last thing that production depends on is nonhuman nature, which is both a key input including raw materials and sources of energy for capitalists and a dumpster for their rubbish (Fraser, 2022, p85). In their pursuit of profit maximization, capitalists seek to exploit nature as cheap as possible by disavowing the ecological costs generated by production. Their perspective is rooted in the myth that nature can replenish itself infinitely and autonomously.
Works Cited
Fraser, N. (2022). Cannibal capitalism: how our system is devouring democracy, care, and the planet - and what we can do about it. Verso.
subject: instructional_rewriting
answer:
Your essay demonstrates a good understanding of the key ideas presented in Nancy Fraser's book "Cannibal Capitalism." However, there are a few areas where you can improve to potentially earn an A grade. Here are some suggestions:

1. Introduction: Your introduction could be more focused on the specific argument you will make in the essay. Start by clearly stating Fraser's main argument and how it extends Marx's insights. This will help set the stage for the rest of your essay.

2. Thesis statement: Make sure to include a clear thesis statement at the end of your introduction that outlines the main points you will discuss in your essay.

3. Structure: Consider organizing your essay into clear sections with subheadings that correspond to the main points you want to make. This will help your reader follow your argument more easily.

4. Analysis: While you have done a good job summarizing Fraser's arguments, try to provide more of your own analysis and insights. For example, you could discuss how the crises Fraser identifies are interconnected and reinforce each other.

5. Examples: Consider including some specific examples or case studies to illustrate the crises Fraser discusses. This will help make your argument more concrete and persuasive.

6. Conclusion: Your conclusion should summarize your main points and restate your thesis. You could also discuss the implications of Fraser's argument for progressive social and political change.

7. Proofreading: Make sure to proofread your essay carefully for any grammatical or typographical errors.

Overall, your essay is well-written and demonstrates a good grasp of the material. By making some of these changes and adding more of your own analysis, you can strengthen your argument and potentially earn an A grade.

question:
I'm an EFL high school teacher and my 12th grade students will be taking a computerized oral skills exam. Can you write these instructions as a humorous dialogue between a smart student and an uniformed student: Here are the instructions..."Instructions for COBE
1) There are 4 questions each worth 25 points. Each questions is actually a "set" of two questions. You MUST answer everything you are asked about including explanations, details and examples. 

2) You are meant to answer each question set in ONE recording. You MAY stop once and continue if you need to. You will lose points if you stop more than once. 

3) You MAY delete your answer and start again, but A) be careful not to use up your time doing this! And B) if you delete, you must start from the beginning. 

4) Watch the clock. You have 30 minutes to answer all 4 questions. The exam will not shut down, but supervisors will ask you to submit your exam on time.
5) Don't worry about some hesitations or mistakes. You are being tested on natural speech which is not perfect. 

6) You may not bring anything with you to the exam, so practice answering a variety of questions about your project and general topics. 

7) You will probably be in a computer room with 3 or 4 other students, so avoid unnecessary noise and record your answers at a normal voice level. 

8) It is VERY IMPORTANT that you listen to your answers to make sure they are heard clearly. You must report ant technical problem immediately. 

9) Your answers should be about 1-2 minutes. For Part B (the project question), you MUST speak for at least one minute or you will lose points. 

10) Practice speaking AND recording. The more you practice, the more familiar this will feel, and the easier it will be. 

Good Luck!"
subject: instructional_rewriting
answer:
Smart Student: Hey, did you read the instructions for the COBE exam yet?

Uniformed Student: Oh, is that the one with the computerized oral skills test?

Smart Student: Yep, that's the one. So, listen up because I'm about to drop some knowledge on you.

Uniformed Student: Lay it on me, wise one.

Smart Student: Alright, first things first. There are 4 questions, each worth 25 points. But here's the tricky part - each question is actually a "set" of two questions. So, make sure you answer everything they throw at you.

Uniformed Student: Got it, answer everything. What's next?

Smart Student: You gotta do it all in one recording. You can stop once and continue if you need to, but if you stop more than once, you lose points.

Uniformed Student: Oof, that's rough. What about if I mess up?

Smart Student: Ah, good question. You can delete your answer and start again, but be careful not to waste time. And if you delete, you gotta start from the beginning.

Uniformed Student: Time management, got it. How long do I have?

Smart Student: 30 minutes to answer all 4 questions. And remember, you should speak for about 1-2 minutes for each answer. Oh, and for the project question, you gotta speak for at least one minute or else you lose points.

Uniformed Student: Sounds intense. Anything else I should know?

Smart Student: Just a couple more things. Practice speaking and recording, and make sure you listen to your answers to check for clarity. And if there's any technical issues, report them ASAP.

Uniformed Student: Got it. Thanks for the tips, wise one.

Smart Student: No problem. Just remember, the more you practice, the easier it'll be. Good luck!
